result.execSummary:
The defendant Don Juan Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Use of Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay the court costs, all applicable surcharges and assessments and the related DNA surcharge at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing on 02-19-2016 and to continue on the 19th of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Don Juan Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Invoice forwarded to accounts payable in the amount of $843.75 to Dr. John Pankiewicz for services on 06/10/2015, 06/18/2015, 06/11/2015, 07/12/2015. Copy In File.
Invoice from Associates in Psychiatry and the Law Forensic and General Psychiatry dated 05/14/2016 in the amount of $843.75 signed and forwarded to the clerk of courts office for payment.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Don Juan Jones in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge be amended to Battery While Armed, pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 940.19(1) and 939.63 (1)(a), a Class A Misemeanor.  Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST to the amended charge.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty to the amended charge and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.    

The Court sentenced defendant to serve 4  DAYS in the House of Corrections, with credit for 4 days time served.  

-Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge 
-Defendant to pay the Court costs, all applicable surcharges and assessments and the related DNA surcharge at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing on February 19, 2016 and to continue on the 19th of each month thereafter until paid in full ; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment

Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court appearing via telephone.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return on doctor's report. Per an email from Justice Point, the defendant was injured, was taken via flight for life, and was hospitalized.  Parties request an adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 22.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Don Juan Jones in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Ron Dague for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Kevin Besaw-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/27/15.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Thomas C. (Unit A) Miriam C. and Frank T. (Unit C)

Defendant Don J Jones in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Don J Jones in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
